title: GPS Firm NextNav To List Via SPAC Merger
text:
The McLean, Va., company is close to a deal to merge with the SPAC Spartacus Acquisition Corp., the people said. Spartacus is focused on deals in the telecom, media and technology industries. The combination is expected to be announced in the coming days.

NextNav is expected to generate roughly $410 million in cash through the deal from the money held by the SPAC and a private investment in public equity, or PIPE, associated with the merger, they said. PIPE investors in the deal are expected to include Koch Strategic Platforms, a subsidiary of Koch Investments Group, and funds managed by Fortress Investment Group.

Existing NextNav investors include funds managed by Fortress and funds managed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management. XM Satellite Radio founder Gary Parsons is the chairman of NextNav.
